post.body: Hahlo is double posting replies.
Nice grid, labels, and copy.
Jinx!
Thanks, trying Delsym at your advice and Han's Natural Honey Loquat Syrup at my pharmacist's. Symptoms are only terrible at night.
Ran Vaporizer all night and lathered chest with Vaporub. Did not help. This virilent virus cough will not be silenced.
Robitussin does not suppress cough, nor does prescription, nor do honey, home remedies, etc. Symptoms resist all treatments.
They call Happy Cog NY with same scam. *Almost* as bad as the guy who takes $$ in the name of veterans and cops (who never see it).
AMAZING.
And then the Taliban ride in.
Why do you hate Christmas?
My daughter explained to me that her brain is the boss of her body. She acted out "boss" by stamping her foot and pouting.
Wow, cool website!
You're on, baby.
My thoughts and prayers to your mom, your family, and you.
responded to a tweet by @jsnell in under 10 minutes. Unreal. I love JetBlue.
Have you seen a doctor? Worried about you.
And now my story is all told.
TMI
I don't know, I was quoting "Ghost Dog: The Way of the Samurai." :)
I think we agree that much of business is better unseen by the public.
Among the maxims on Lord Naoshige's wall, there was this one: "Matters of great concern should be treated lightly."
Exactly, that's all I'm saying.
Brother, I wasn't calling you out.
There's nothing shameful in keeping work methods and salaries confidential, or deciding not to show a client a particular comp.
I wouldn't want a client looking over my shoulder while I create rough drafts, or listening to a heated internal disagreement.
Ho, ho, ho!
Very true. Transparency is a lovely theory, but business mostly happens behind closed doors. For good reason.
Web dev blogs are read by professionals who want to be expert web craftsmen. Doesn't a below-market HTML service ad undercut that?
Why, thank you, Ma'am!
Now I understand.
I don't like lightbixes either. I'm watching Aaron give a lecture. He's brilliant.
Great minds.

Dog *is* home. I'm traveling.
Shi'zu, rescue.
Thanks! URL?
http://twitpic.com/rklg - Ewww.
My pleasure, my friend. Thanks for the kind words.
I'm hoping "thong" means something different in Australia.
Aarron Walter and Daniel Mall will address those topics in An Event Apart 2009. Look for schedules and a redesigned site in Jan.
20 is huge.
Walton on Thames.
Might be an accessibility thing having nothing to do with the height of the masthead, sir. Just saying.
May I be the first to wish you a happy birthday?
I like it.
Congrats.
New home far better except for neighbor noise, smoke, and smell leakage.
Happy birthday. You've entered a new demographic. One advertisers aren't trying to reach. Enjoy!
Why even read this guy? He's a jackass with a hundred pound chip on his shoulder.
That's called "using Safari."
r/t It's a Charlie Brown Ad Agency Christmas http://cli.gs/7459PP
I love how NY State disqualifies your jury duty form if you fail to use a No 2 pencil. Like not being called to serve is a punishment.
Old ladies elbowing me aside, cutting in line at Medical Center. Memory of good manners is the first thing to go.
Wife's cough subsided enough by 2 AM that she could sleep. Mine persisted past 4:30. I've had, maybe, two hours' sleep. I'm dangerous.
Wife and I lie like twin Chopins, coughing all night. There is no medicine for it, and no sleep. Cough. Cough. Cough. Cough. Cough. Cough.
Last night I cleaned feces out of a bathtub and woke drowning in my own phlegm. Now what was it you wanted to discuss about these web pages?
More people need to follow @iancorey . I shouldn't be the only one starring his stuff.
Did I forget to mention http://www.alistapart.com/issues/273 is about the benefits of traditional IA vs. the joy of agile design?
To friends who have recently lost jobs, been there (could be there again tomorrow), feel for you, rooting for you. Meanwhile, #freelance
Ancient man grinning moronically while hiking up your pants outside the medical center, God bless.
Tour bus trying to run me over on Second Avenue is labeled "New World." New world, same assholes.
Home missing a swell party. But glad to be on my pajamas.
You had me at collapse onblur.
20 signs you donâ€™t want that web design project. http://tinyurl.com/654v72
Hacking Doestoevskian oysters.
Once again, a deep, painful, rasping cough, regular as clockwork, kept Carrie up all night. (Mine subsided enough that I was able to sleep.)
Cold coffee compresses, held against the eyelid for 30 seconds, help when you wake up with red, goopy eyes.
Wonderful, winking Christmas lights do everything for New York Penn Station that a Glade scented candle does for a latrine.
Our four year old just invented the job of the future: ecotecht.

ME: It's cold out here and we're sick. Maybe we should go back indoors.
4YO AVA: I'm afraid you're right.
Sick man taking sick daughter to freezing cold park for an hour before leaving for Boston by train.
I'll worry about them while I'm in Boston.
When wife stopped coughing, daughter began crying. So went the night.
You're all getting Gollum/Smeagol bookends for Christmas. No, don't thank me.
I know the names of the stars of Blues Clues and prefer one to the other. I officially have no life.
Dick on elevator yelling onto mobile phone: "Have you got any news for me. News for me. NEWS. What's going on with the foreclosures?"
Judging by his tunes, this Beethoven dude seems to have listened to a *lot* of Kraftwerk.
If the economy sticks to its present course, I'm going to have to lay myself off.
Web development blog runs ads for cut-rate template service?
Amtrak. Always be boarding.
Have not seen my dog since Sunday morning, but I can smell him on my raincoat.
With great power come high electric bills.
Packing for the train trip back home to New York. Bye bye, Boston!
Spend two days at a web design conference, miss a whole Blagojevich.
SILENCE!
Your tweet that linked to the exact same tweet on FriendFeed that linked to a two word post by Kottke linking to actual content was awesome.
It's like a hoagie of bad user experience.
A friend's use of FriendFeed and Google Reader yields triple tweets. Contentless tweets link to aggregators containing unexplained links.
We're reliably informed that Steve Jobs decides whether or not his employees may marry, and Jeff Bozos reserves the droit de seigneur.
Daughter woke crying 4:30 AM, throat sore, eyes crusty with endless head cold. Rocked her back to sleep. Was not able to sleep again myself.
http://shortyawards.com/ I don't mind losing to guykawasaki, but capnsmackers?
I like #design.
I'm trying to DM Luke Wroblewski but can't remember his Twitter name. Assmonkey? Assmagnet? There was ass in it, I'm sure.
It seems I have to beg for nominations. Very well. http://shortyawards.com/
http://shortyawards.com/ "The Shorty Awards honor the world's top Twitterers."
Have had a not unexpected, yet still awful, emotional shock. Trying to function normally while processing.
Just when it seemed I had finally recovered, I have a sore throat and cold.
Back in NYC riding bus toward home. I know I'm in my hometown cuz the loony seated next to me yells "Come on!" every time the bus stops.
When life hands you lemons, get a lawyer.
Enjoyed a long, warm talk with my brother in England. Thanks, Pete. I needed that.
Made the kid (who has the appetite of a fashion model) a good brunch and she ate it. Victory! Now on to the bookstore.
How does paper get you clean, anyway? It's a mystery.
If I'm ever accused of a serious crime, I'll want a tireless defender who never lacks for a counter-argument. I'll hire my four-year-old.
Just heard a completely unneccessary cover version of "Blackbird, Singing in the Dead of Night."
We did it.
"Maybe they're just *pretending* to be elves," says four year old Ava as we work our way down the Macy's Santa line.
The line at Macy's Santa Land goes on forever. We are somewhere in the middle of it.
Preparing for a visit to Macy's Santa Claus. (It was that or a lecture on ethical culturism, and four's a bit young.)
Up all night writing a letter. Even worse, sent it.
Nothing says "Christmas in New York" like the annual tipping of super, doormen, and porters. No tip, however generous, can truly repay them.
Man goes into a bar, orders cranberry juice. Bartender says, "Alcoholic?" Man says, "Does it show?"
FAVRD needs a symbol for when it's down or gapping or slow or timing out. Fail croissant?
And in Web 1.0 news, webhamster.com has made a hostile takeover bid for Dancing Baby.
Brrrr! It's like Wassilia out here. Except for all the book learning.
What does a web designer need most? http://tinyurl.com/6d32hu
Those who think "steaming pile of sh_t" is merely a picturesque turn of phrase have never walked a dog when it's 13ËšF outside.
I feel like a guy with a cold and sore throat who's been woken up once an hour all night by a crying child.
Middle Age: When clothing, detergent and beer advertisers stop vying for your attention, and Depends and FirstAlert haven't started yet.
The drunks upstairs, bellowing at one another, woke me at 3:00 AM.
Ava and her uncle Fred made a kick-ass Garageband jam last night.
Carrie was sick again last night. Enough, already.
Met a man so young he made me realize I was old. Then he talked about his job and I was relieved to be grown up.
Guarding coffeeshop table marine style while awaiting a friend. Stare hungrily at my table one more time, Mr Slick. You ain't gettin' it.
Enjoyed the furious snow. Less fond of this freezing rain. Frogs next.
A cold white eternity enfolds the skyscrapers.
It's snowing like a Joseph Conrad novel out there.
